programme.desc: Comedy panel show, with Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood, actress Sheila Hancock and 8 Out of 10 Cats regular Jon Richardson arguing to have the things they hate consigned to the notorious room, while host Frank Skinner has the final say. Their gripes include house guests, women's toilets and dancing - and one of the celebrities even wants rid of their own brain.

programme.title: Asian Provocateur
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan parts ways with his mother temporarily for a spiritual journey across Mexico with his uncle Ragu. Originally planned as a trip Ragu was hoping to take with Romesh's father before his death, the trek sees the pair take in a blindfolded spirit walk through rugged jungle terrain, and a terrifying simulated illegal border crossing into the US. While Romesh dials down his usual negativity for his uncle's sake, nothing can prepare him for the uncomfortable horror of an authentic Mexican '80s night, or an encounter with a local shaman that once again places the comedian face-to-face with a live chicken.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory. programme.title: Asian Provocateur
programme.desc: Having spent time away from his mother during his trip to Mexico, Romesh Ranganathan reunites with her in Los Angeles, where she has been spending time with long-lost relatives, the De Silvas. However, much to Romesh's annoyance, Shanthi has thoroughly enjoyed being apart from her son. programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey profiles two of Britain's greatest wartime leaders. He begins by revealing how Winston Churchill came to write a biography of his ancestor John, who led the nation against Louis XIV of France. Starkey also explores how preparations for the Second World War were affected by the prime minister's knowledge of his 17th-century forebear's achievements.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey explains how writing a biography of his ancestor John, the first Duke of Marlborough, changed the way Winston Churchill was seen by the public and politicians, and so paved the way for his return to power. The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.

A guilt-ridden Honey decides to tell Steve their relationship is over, Neil pours out his heart to Andrea, and Yvonne learns she's no longer Acting Sergeant - leading to much speculation about her replacement.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jaws drop at Sun Hill as June Ackland returns to take up the post of sergeant, a mere two months after her retirement. Meanwhile, Gary finds himself implicated in a money-laundering operation after falling for a woman's charms, and Andrea agonises over whether to tell Neil the reason for her refusal to commit to a relationship.

programme.title: The Bill

Gary swears revenge on the female con-artist who inveigled him into the money laundering scam, and Leela is dismayed to learn Amber will be joining her on an advanced driving course, while Andrea tries to avoid exposure as an undercover journalist by promising her editor a scoop on Gabriel's murderous misdeeds.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Equipment has been stolen from the company's stores, and the theft threatens Anderson's chances of promotion. Starring Robert Glenister.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Return of the military drama series, starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn. The Kings Fusiliers embark on a grueling rock climbing exercise in Snowdonia.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Andrea is partnered with Gabriel and begins digging into his past, discovering a possible link to the Sun Hill sniper and learning of Dale's suspicions that June could be the crooked copper's mother. Realising that she's up to something, Gabriel threatens her with violence - and her perilous situation isn't improved when Neil spots her deep in conversation with editor Bruce Malcolm and realises she's been leaking developments at Sun Hill to the Press.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Medical drama series charting life on the wards of Holby City Hospital.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Though still troubled by recent events, Tina works on - but gets little sympathy from Eve. However, in due course, the full details about her earlier ordeal emerge. Sam tells Sunny that he has found a flatmate, while Baz sees Zoe kiss Charlie and an Elvis impersonator is admitted complaining of chest pains.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Andrea fights to save her relationship and reputation by exposing Gabriel as the Sun Hill sniper - but editor Bruce Malcolm has other ideas. Dale reprimands Colin Fairfax for his racist attitude, while Samantha gives evidence at the trial of serial rapist Alan Kennedy and manages to outmanoeuvre a defence QC who accuses her of securing a confession by means of psychological torture.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Tricky Dicky's friendship with Rachel takes an unexpected turn, and Kathy gets an unwanted guest. A disaster at the Queen Vic shocks Albert Square.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Rachel confides her true feelings for Richard to Michelle. Phil learns that desperate measures may not solve his problems - can the Queen Vic remain in business?.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch desperately try to save Bayleaf's life as time starts running out, while Hallam and Recall are rushed into hospital.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Curiosity gets the better of Archie's girlfriend Justine, who arrives from London, only to discover he needs to lay a few old ghosts to rest in his Highland retreat. Meanwhile, Hector suspects Molly has a secret lover. Light-hearted drama, starring Richard Briers, Susan Hampshire, Alastair MacKenzie and Lorraine Pilkington.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim makes plans for a restful weekend off, but is angered at being assigned to act as minder to a visiting French electronics contractor at the last minute. His irritation is heightened when he discovers that the man, Anton Charet, had an affair with his ex-wife. Detective drama, starring John Nettles and James Faulkner.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Mrs Boswell bonds with new neighbour Celia, and Billy manages to upset Adrian in the middle of a poetry recital in the kitchen.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Joe Maplin hatches a hare-brained scheme to stop a hospital being built next to the camp site, ordering staff to make a din from dawn till dusk while the council committee conduct an inspection visit. Jimmy Perry and David Croft's comedy, starring Ruth Madoc, Paul Shane and Su Pollard.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy has relationship problems and Jean frets when Judith starts dating a married man. At a dinner party attended by Penny and Stephen, Lionel has to steer the conversation away from personal matters. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Barry becomes dejected when his fitness-mad neighbour Boothroyd begins to outshine him in all things physical. However, he discovers that when it comes to karate, he may just have an advantage over his new rival. Long-running comedy, guest starring Brian Conley.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When a woman is found dead at a health spa, a convalescing Dalziel decides to mix business with pleasure and books himself in - but finds more than he bargained for. Meanwhile, Pascoe is bitten by the love bug and runs the risk of making a real fool of himself. Norman Wisdom guest stars, with Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A police informant resurfaces after 17 years on the run, and claims to have details implicating a crook-turned-celebrity in an unsolved armed robbery. Sandra accompanies Strickland to the Hero of the Year Awards, where the recipient of the title is an old rival of Gerry's - who is brought in to work on the case. With guest star Steven Berkoff.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A body is discovered in the burned-out basement of a Glasgow factory and a straightforward case of arson suddenly turns into a murder inquiry, giving Burke the chance to put his squad of fledgling detectives to the test. Crime drama, starring Alex Norton, Blythe Duff and John Michie.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Kenneth Branagh stars as the world-weary Swedish detective in a fourth and final series of adaptations of Henning Mankell's novels. Wallander travels to Cape Town to investigate the disappearance of a Swedish woman. He uncovers a complex conspiracy behind the mystery, and is also confronted with a nation that has reached a turning point in its history.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Winsford Walled Garden in Devon, to answer the owner's horticultural queries.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The Fusiliers and their families arrive in Hong Kong, but have a hard time adjusting to their new surroundings and the climate. Starring Jerome Flynn and Robson Green.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A female boxer is injured in an illegal match, floored by a headbutt, and vows revenge on the person responsible. The charity football match is staged, though Josh feels obliged to 200 to its proceeds, while Elliot and Eve are advised by police their chances of successfully pressing charges are slim.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Andrea's cover has been well and truly blown, leaving her to face the wrath of Gina and fatally compromising her testimony at the trial of rapist Alan Kennedy, who is acquitted. Desperate for a chance to redeem herself, she makes one last effort to gather incriminating evidence against Gabriel - only to end up being held hostage in a store room by the crazed copper. Events come to a head when Colin is dismissed after being exposed as a vicious racist and retaliates by handcuffing Ken in a petrol-doused van and crashing it into Sun Hill's front office. Blissfully unaware of the escalating crisis, Reg calls Marilyn's mobile phone at the station, intending to ask for her hand in marriage - and triggers a massive explosion.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mandy finds a videotape that could destroy a marriage. Phil's got some bad news and sparks fly between Kathy and Pauline.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Cindy wonders why Ian has decided to contact her again after two years. Mandy realises her time at Kathy's could be running out. Phil gets some useful info from Tricky Dicky.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blackwall fire station is threatened with closure when it is rumoured a new station is being built close by. Meanwhile, Hallam receives some counselling after his accident.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: A historian discovers a long-lost diary in the family closet, shocking the Glenbogle community and proving a source of acute embarrassment for Hector. Duncan is led to believe he may be the heir to a fortune, which he hopes to use to win over Lexie. Light-hearted drama, starring Richard Briers, Susan Hampshire, Hamish Clark and Dawn Steele.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.sub-title: When Did You Last See Your Father?
programme.desc: A young woman is attacked on the overnight ferry to Jersey. A scrap-dealer initiially comes under suspicion, though Jim is inclined to believe the culprit is the arrogant son of a wealthy company lawyer and finds himself at odds with Crozier over which man is responsible. Drama, starring John Nettles and Sean Arnold.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Billy's romantic overtures do not go down well when he tries to reconcile with Julie, forcing him to return to the bosom of his family.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: A tattered shoebox filled with money arrives for Jeffrey, with instructions from Joe Maplin that it be used to bribe local councillors to not build a hospital next to the holiday camp. Comedy, starring Paul Shane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel's peaceful weekend in the country is disrupted when they find the faithful Mrs Bale is not her usual cheerful self. To add to their woes, Lionel feels unwell - but a visit from a doctor with a strange bedside manner sheds light on their housekeeper's mood.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will the Genuine Racer Please Stand Up?
programme.desc: Howard becomes ill at ease with his lot in life, and tries to change his appearance so that not even Pearl would recognise him. But he soon discovers that the drawbacks of assuming someone else's identity are greater than the benefits.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The maverick judge finds his principles tested by the offer of a place on the Appellate Bench in return for hushing up a diplomatic incident. Convinced that an Arab sheikh's driver is covering for his boss over the murder of a prostitute, he is forced to decide whether to see justice done or yield to the temptation of the bribe and back off in the 'national interest'. Drama, starring Martin Shaw.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad investigates a long-running feud between two family ice-cream businesses, which resulted in a shooting and several armed raids 10 years ago. Standing enlists the aid of his daughter in cracking the case, and she discovers evidence of drug dealing - but Pullman does not approve of her involvement. With Dennis Waterman and Amanda Redman, alongside guest star Jodie Kelly.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The body of a prostitute found in a river makes Ross realise an old adversary is importing girls from overseas to work in the vice trade. Unfortunately, his impetuous handling of the case puts others in danger and threatens to bring his career to an ignominious end - until he redeems himself with some quick thinking that gives the team a vital lead. Drama, starring Blythe Duff, John Michie and Colin McCredie.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a body is found half-buried in a swamp. Visiting her home, Wallander discovers signs of an intruder and that the dead woman's daughter is missing. The return of a lost love distracts him from the case at hand, as he encounters a gang of bikers that have been causing trouble in the area and begins to suspect he is being watched.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward returns to Barton House in Warwickshire to talk to its owners about the work involved in creating their 12-acre site, which is opening for a few days as part of the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An inferno sweeps through Sun Hill station in the aftermath of the explosion, giving Gabriel the chance to make good his escape, callously leaving Andrea trapped under fallen debris as the flames creep closer. Dale also faces a fiery demise in the burning building, while Jim struggles to accept the news that his friend Ken was killed instantly when the van blew up. Marilyn fights for life in hospital, a grief-stricken Reg at her bedside - and as he tearfully slips an engagement ring onto her finger, an ominous bleep from her cardiac monitor heralds a tragic end to their relationship.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle suggests a girls' night out with Sharon at her college, but the evening ends in disaster when Grant and Clyde turn up.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Clyde hears some unpleasant home truths from Michelle, and a confession rocks Sharon and Grant's marriage.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch come to the rescue of an old firefighter. Colin's probation period ends. The team also tackle a blaze in the attic of a house. Starring Steve North.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie's wayward sister Lizzie turns up with her New Age guru boyfriend Gerald, and tries to convert Glenbogle into a healing centre. Katrina is furious that the well in her garden has dried up, and gamekeeper Golly loses his knack of wooing the opposite sex. Richard Briers and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A visiting athlete provokes confusion on the island - especially as he appears to be linked with Philippa Vale. Jim, Charlie and a hitman find themselves running around in circles before order is restored, and a mystery surrounding Valley Farm is solved. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian is arrested while riding his bicycle, and the family decides to keep Pa Boswell's health problems a secret from him.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Ted gets up to his usual tricks, using every money-raising fiddle in the book to fend off bailiffs threatening him with prison for failing to pay maintenance to his ex-wife. Paul Shane and Simon Cadell star in Jimmy Perry and David Croft's holiday camp comedy.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean return from a weekend away to find Judith's boyfriend has been staying at the house. To add to their woes, Alistair announces he has got engaged to a girl named Mercury - dashing their hopes of his ever becoming their son-in-law. Comedy starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: A Short Introduction to Cooper's Rules
programme.desc: Local PCs Cooper and Walsh try to master a new crime-fighting technique. However, the duo's carefully laid plans unravel when Barry decides to treat a retired vicar to a day trip. Long-running sitcom, starring Ken Kitson and Louis Emerick.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: DCI Adams' investigations into a spate of domestic robberies result in an accusation of sexual harassment against him from a young nurse. Hetty is convinced he has been wrongly accused and investigates the claim from her hospital bed.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: When their lead suspect is murdered in a laboratory, Peregrine and James are forced to admit that their killer's motives go far deeper than they had both dared to consider.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A man wrongly convicted of burning down a school is released, and seeks Halford's help in tracking down the culprit. Standing meets a woman who claims to be his daughter (played by Dennis Waterman's real-life daughter Hannah) but Lane is not convinced she is telling the truth. Pullman is offered a promotion to head of the Murder Squad. Kevin Whately and Joe Absalom guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Investigating the mysterious death of a youngster at an elite Glasgow school, Burke incurs the wrath of the local press and finds himself branded a bully for his rough tactics. Ross goes undercover and soon discovers links with the shady world of drug-dealing. Drama, starring Blythe Duff and Alex Norton.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: The detective takes on his most challenging case as he searches for Linda's father-in-law, with the only clue to his whereabouts being an incident on board a submarine 25 years ago. As the case takes a devastating turn, Wallander is plunged into the shady world of Cold War-era politics and faces a battle to protect his daughter. Final episode of the crime drama, starring Kenneth Branagh.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Headland Garden in Polruan, Cornwall - one of the participants opening its havens to the public in the National Gardens Scheme - where plants face the harsh conditions of salt air and high winds.

programme.desc: Kezia and Smithy work together on a courier van hijack and soon get a result, but later find themselves in trouble for scaring one of Keith Durante's rape victims. programme.desc: Jean and Lionel settle down to enjoy a quiet evening, only to find themselves constantly disturbed by ominous noises from the empty house next door. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detectives investigate the death of a woman who has been killed in a hit-and-run incident. Suspicion falls on the man who found her body, but he denies ever having met her. Lynley and Havers visit the victim's estranged husband and son, neither of whom has seen her since she walked out after her daughter's murder 30 years previously. Nathaniel Parker and Sharon Small star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra takes drastic measures to prevent Jack exacting revenge on the hit-and-run driver who killed his wife. Amanda Redman and Lynda Bellingham star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. DS Boyd is approached by a woman convinced her father's death in a car crash was not an accident or suicide, but something far more sinister. Intrigued by the evidence she has collected, he agrees to re-open the case, and with the help of forensic scientist Dr Frankie Wharton, investigates a third option not previously considered. Trevor Eve and Holly Aird star.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: Adam and Karen's future is thrown into jeopardy by an unexpected offer, and David is in turmoil over his growing feelings for Robyn. While Jenny braces herself for her first mammogram after her treatment for cancer, Pete helps their son Adam realise his dream. John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst star in the concluding instalment of the ninth season of Mike Bullen's long-running comedy drama, with guest appearances by Frances Barber and Paul Ritter.

programme.desc: In 10 years Airbnb has grown into a multimillion-dollar global entity - and revolutionised the way people travel. But there are claims that short-term lets not only threaten the future of traditional hotels, but could be contributing to housing shortages - as well as driving up the cost of properties. Jonathan Maitland investigates.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: Over the past 25 years, portion sizes have increased by 100 per cent - and plates have got bigger too - none of which is good news for people's diet. With this in mind, Ranj Singh checks out the breakfast buffet to see whether people know how many calories they are piling on their plates and Sian Williams tests off-the-shelf portion-control gadgets, including smaller cutlery to help eat more slowly. Plus, two more diets are put to the test - the Metabolism Reset Diet, based around a detox for the liver, and Bosh! Healthy Vegan, which means ditching the junk.

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Scotland (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the opening game in the third round of fixtures, which takes place at the Stadio Olimpico in Rome. Both sides are without a win so far, with Italy showing some improvement against France after a heavy defeat to Wales, and Scotland producing spirited displays in narrow losses to Ireland and England. With analysis from Ian McGeechan, Maggie Alphonsi, Gareth Thomas and Marco Bortolami, and commentary by Miles Harrison, Scott Hastings and Ben Kay.

programme.title: Tipping Point

programme.desc: Dismissed from the Anti-Villain League after botching a mission, Gru sets off to meet his long-lost twin brother. Animated sequel, with the voices of Steve Carell, Kristen Wiig and Trey Parker.

programme.desc: The popular duo return with a new series of the entertainment show, in which Ant v Dec goes global. This series will feature the biggest ever giveaway in British TV history and a finale coming from a very special location. In the first episode, Stephen Mulhern joins Ant and Dec in the studio.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the first of this year's Battle Rounds in the singing contest. Coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor all return to their infamous red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions go head to head and fight for their place on their coach's team. The singers that impress their coach the most remain in the competition with a chance of winning a recording contract. Will those that aren't so lucky be stolen by another coach or will they be going home?.

programme.title: Live Boxing
programme.desc: Brad Foster v Lucien Reid. Coverage of the rematch for the British and Commonwealth Super Bantamweight titles, which takes place at the York Hall in London's Bethnal Green. The fighters shared the spoils in a majority draw when they met here five months ago, with one judge giving Reid the nod and the other two scoring it even. This time around both men will be determined to maintain their unbeaten record and ensure there is a decisive outcome in their favour.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: The contestants are guaranteed some fine food today as their mystery host is celebrity chef Aldo Zilli. Can he cook up enough cryptic clues to hide his Italian identity or will he be getting out the Fairy Liquid when the diners have all gone home? Brian McFadden plays go-between.

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Ireland (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the final match in the third round of fixtures, which takes place at Twickenham. England bounced back from a defeat at the hands of France by recording a 13-6 victory over Scotland at Murrayfield. However, they now face another tough test against the Irish, who are chasing the Triple Crown after wins against the Scots and Wales under new coach Andy Farrell. With analysis from Clive Woodward, Jonny Wilkinson and Brian O'Driscoll, pitchside reports by Martin Bayfield, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Lawrence Dallaglio and Gordon D'Arcy.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: It's Movie Week as the remaining celebrities and their partners battle it out to stay in the competition and secure a place in the semi-final. Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean head up the ice panel, alongside Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman, and there's a performance from Luke Evans alongside the professional skaters. Hosted by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: When the detective is called to investigate what appears to be a freak accident at Lady Matilda's College, he uncovers a potential link between a series of peculiar incidents across Oxford. Despite Thursday's scepticism, he becomes convinced the accidents are the result of foul play. Lady Matilda's meanwhile, is in the midst of a referendum campaign which will decide whether or not the college should become co-educational. When a woman is attacked while walking alone on a towpath, Endeavour and Thursday try to find the assailant before they strike again. Drama, starring Shaun Evans.

programme.title: Cilla: The Lost Tapes
programme.desc: Following her death, Cilla Black's family found a stash of films and behind-the-scenes footage from her personal video collection, along with hours of audio recording of Cilla telling her life story. Narrated by Sheridan Smith, this documentary includes interviews with the family and friends who knew Cilla best, as they watch the lost footage for the first time and recall their memories of a TV icon.

programme.title: Harry Redknapp's Sandbanks Summer
programme.desc: Former football manager Harry Redknapp welcomes celebrity friends to his house in Sandbanks, Britain's most exclusive and expensive seaside resort, offering an insight into this unique part of the British south coast peninsula. In the first episode, Harry is joined by Neil Razor' Ruddock and Joe Pasquale. Neil is considering a move to the area, so Harry takes him and Joe to see a very desirable 5 million penthouse with some of the best views Sandbanks has to offer.

programme.title: The BRIT Awards 2020
programme.desc: Jack Whitehall hosts the 40th edition of the annual music awards. Stormzy, Michael Kiwanuka, Lewis Capaldi, Dave and Harry Styles are in the running for Album of the Year, while Celeste has been announced as the recipient of this year's Rising Star Award. The show will feature performances from Mabel, Harry Styles, Stormzy, Billie Eilish, Lewis Capaldi and Celeste.

programme.desc: When recently widowed Vivien announces her love for a new man, Mark, it throws her family of adult children into chaos. The siblings' suspicions about Mark are fuelled by rising tensions in their own lives. Helen's focus on her job has led to a rift in her marriage, Jake's gambling debts have caused his wife and kids to leave him, and Natalie is lying to everybody about her secret relationship. Meanwhile, Vivien's neighbour, Mary, is simply trying to protect the family she has known for years.But in a few weeks one of these people will be lying on the beach, terribly injured - perhaps dead. Meanwhile, Natalie struggles deal with her situation with Tony, and Jake turns to Stella for advice. Later, Jake unearths a darkly disturbing secret about Mark's past. Starring Francesca Annis, Imelda Staunton and Stephen Rea.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Carly is in court to claim 350 for various loans she made to her friend. Defendant Evija claims that there was no deadline attached to the loan and therefore she should be given more time to pay. Criminal barrister Robert Rinder presides over their conflicting causes.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five university friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Lucy, Anthony, Hilary and Sam pit their wits against the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Inside MI5: Keeping The UK Safe - Tonight
programme.desc: Rohit Kachroo gains access to MI5, one of the world's oldest and most-renowned spy agencies. Filmed as London experienced two terror attacks at Fishmonger's Hall and Streatham, Tonight sees the engine room of the UK's fight against terror. Surveillance officers and investigators also discuss their secret work and its impact on their lives.

programme.title: Flesh and Blood
programme.desc: Vivien tries to dismiss her children's fears about Mark, even as serious doubts creep into her mind. Jake's chances of reconciling with Leila suffer a potentially fatal blow. Helen is desperate to patch things up with George, even as her career hangs in the balance. Drama, starring Francesca Annis and Imelda Staunton.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: The final two diets to be put through their paces are the TwoChubbyCubs Diet in which fakeaways' are on the menu, and the trendy Collagen Diet, in which a bone broth plan claims to keep you fuller for longer. Sian Williams and Dr Ranj Singh present.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore talks to Piers about his career and personal life, including his spectacular fall from grace in the early 2000s when 31-year-old Stuart Lubbock was found dead in his swimming pool following a party at his home. Barrymore was never charged in relation to the death, but the controversy has dogged his career ever since and he has rarely been seen on television, besides a successful appearance in the 2006 edition of Celebrity Big Brother, where he finished as runner-up. He also talks about his close friendship with Princess Diana, the depths of his drug and alcohol addictions and the moment in which he came out as gay.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Boxing promoter Kellie Maloney throws a dinner party for four strangers at her Essex home. Brian McFadden hosts the game show where diners try to guess the identity of a mystery host holding a dinner party in order to win a cash prize.
